 GeneticAlgorithm ()

abstract Chromosome< TGene > GeneratorFunction ()
 The generator function.

Must be overriden.

virtual double FitnessFunction (Chromosome< TGene > chromosome, double averageEvaluation)
 The fitness function.

The fitness function transforms that measure (measure provided by the evaluation function) into an allocation of reproductiove opportunities.

The fitness of that string, however, is always defined with respect to other members of the current population.

In the caconical genetic algorithm, fitness is defined by: f_i / f_avg where f_i is the evaluation associated with string i and f_avg is the average evaluation of all the strings in the population. Fitness can be assigned based on a string's rank in the population or by sampling methods, such as tournament selection.

Can be overriden.

abstract void CrossoverFunction (Chromosome< TGene > parent1, Chromosome< TGene > parent2, out Chromosome< TGene > offspring1, out Chromosome< TGene > offspring2, double crossoverRate)
 The crossover function.

Crossovers the chromosome with some other chromosome to create (two) offsprings with some probability p_c.

Must be overriden.

abstract void MutationFunction (Chromosome< TGene > chromosome, double mutationRate)
 The mutation function.

Mutates the chromosome with some probability p_m.

Must be overriden.

class GeneticAlgorithm::GeneticAlgorithm< TGene >

template<TGene >
virtual double GeneticAlgorithm.GeneticAlgorithm< TGene >.FitnessFunction ( Chromosome< TGene >  chromosome,
double  averageEvaluation 
) [protected, virtual]

The fitness function.

The fitness function transforms that measure (measure provided by the evaluation function) into an allocation of reproductiove opportunities.

The fitness of that string, however, is always defined with respect to other members of the current population.

In the caconical genetic algorithm, fitness is defined by: f_i / f_avg where f_i is the evaluation associated with string i and f_avg is the average evaluation of all the strings in the population. Fitness can be assigned based on a string's rank in the population or by sampling methods, such as tournament selection.

Can be overriden.

Parameters:
chromosome The chromosome to be ranked.
averageEvaluation The average evaluation of all chromosomes in the (current) population.

Is acceptable solution found?

Parameters:
acceptableEvaluation The acceptable evaluation (i.e. evaluation sufficiently low (when minimizing) or sufficiently high (when maximizing)).
Returns:

Runs the genetic algorithm.

Parameters:
objectiveFunction The objective function.

Parameters:
maxGenerationCount The maximum number of generations.
usedGenerationCount The number of generation taken.
acceptableEvaluation The acceptable evaluation (i.e. evaluation sufficiently low (when minimizing) or sufficiently high (when maximizing)).
achievedEvalaution The achieved evalaution.

Parameters:
populationSize The size of the population (i.e. the number of chromosomes in the population).
crossoverRate The rate of crossover.
mutationRate The rate of mutation.
scaling The scaling flag.
Returns:
The best solution (the global-best chromosome).
